Description: A long string of large spherical, mis-shapen spherical, conical and oblate beads, all of glazed composition. On the larger blue-green beads the glaze is bright although most of them have a roughened surface. The smaller beads are more green in colour and the glaze is not so shiny.
Curator's comments: The shapes and quality of the glaze are typical of Middle Kingdom beads (cf. J. Garstang, ‘el Arabah’ (London, 1901), pl.I, from tombs E 108 and E 45).
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (511)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
